title.rendered: Pros and Cons Of Living in Los Angeles

content.rendered:
Are you thinking of moving to Los Angeles? LA, an iconic tourism destination, is a massive city with almost four million inhabitants. Residents living in LA enjoy everything from the pleasant Mediterranean climate and world-famous beaches to the harsh highlands and beautiful deserts. In this post, we’ll learn more about the pros and cons of living in Los Angeles. Ultimately, we’re going to help you make the right decision about whether this city is for you!

Related: Is moving to Los Angeles for you? Making the big move

Pros of Living in Los Angeles

1. Outdoor Recreational Activities

With a plethora of free outdoor activities right on your doorstep, access to an unbelievable amount of events happening everyday, and, of course, landmarks/museums/monuments to visit, it’s virtually impossible to become bored when living in Los Angeles. There’s always something entertaining going on, whatever you’re into.

2. Pleasant Weather

Los Angeles is renowned for its pleasant weather all year. In fact, the city receives almost 300 days of sunshine each year, so it’s easy for Angelenos to enjoy the benefits of city living with outdoor fun. Beautiful beaches, parks, a variety of hiking routes, outdoor entertainment, alfresco dining, and much more are all available.

3. Supportive City For Artists & Dreamers

If you’re relocating to Los Angeles, you’ll be moving to a city brimming with artists, visionaries, and doers. All of whom contribute to the never-ending world-class entertainment options available to you every day of the week!

Many people living in LA pursue jobs beyond the 9-to-5, such as acting, writing, and other creative endeavors. If you’re having second thoughts about your office job and want to do something on the side, LA is a wonderful place to start because you’ll have access to a new realm of possibilities, contacts, and like-minded people.

4. Balanced Lifestyle

LA has real respect for leisure, despite being a large and bustling city that can be rather stressful at times. From the clothes, down to the “you do you” mentality, everything appears to be more casual in LA. People in suits, and those with traditional 9-5 occupations, are not so common. This city, for the most part, promotes a healthy work-life balance, which can be quite uplifting.

5. Progressive & Diverse Culture

Los Angeles is widely appreciated for being a “melting pot” of several cultures, each of which is welcomed as a member of the broader LA community. Design, art, music, food, and so much more are all covered. You won’t have to travel far to see new locations, meet new people, and have amazing adventures.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Hawthorne, Los Angeles

Cons of Living in Los Angeles

1. Parking

It’s never easy to get a parking spot in Los Angeles. If it isn’t a general shortage of parking, it is the cost, the location, the valet, the waiting, the – you get the picture. You could be in for a costly and stressful encounter. If you’re unlucky enough to misinterpret a parking notice or fail to fill the meter, you’re in for a big parking charge.

2. Highly Competitive Job Market

Despite the fact that the Los Angeles job market is prospering in comparison to the rest of California and the US, finding the perfect opportunity might be tough if you don’t know where to look. Many residents of this city connect their lives with tourism and entertainment, yet it’s also the country’s largest urban manufacturing center.

If you’re moving to LA, there are jobs available in steel, automobiles, clothes, and electronics industries. Further, employment in technology is also in high demand. There are also a number of roles in the public sector, whether you want to be a cop, a fireman, or a paramedic.

3. High Cost of Living

Be prepared to live a pricey lifestyle, if you’re moving to LA! Housing costs are high in all attractive areas and have only continued to climb till now. The cost of living in Los Angeles is 43% more than the national average (more than 50% in some neighborhoods). To rent an apartment in Los Angeles, you’ll need more than the annual median salary, for real! However, living in LA is still cheaper than living in NYC or SF. But only by a little margin.

4. Public Transportation & Traffic

One of the benefits of living in a city is that you may save money on gas and car upkeep by taking public transportation. This is a luxury that you won’t find living in Los Angeles. While the transportation system has improved over time, it’s still far from perfect.

Because the city is rather spread out, unless you live close to your workplace, you’ll inevitably have to commute during the day. This involves traveling down the notorious LA roads, which are constantly clogged to the brim.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Koreatown, LA

Is Moving to LA for you?

The pros and cons of living in Los Angeles largely come down to your own priorities. Everyone wants something different, and you can make what you want out of it.

But keep in mind that while LA is another large, stunning metropolis, it’s nothing compared to New York, Chicago, DC, or even Paris, London, and Tokyo. That being said, the pros and cons of living in Los Angeles do not undermine LA’s unique approach to “big city life”.
